sub_title: Director, International Development Unit at Ecorys
summary:
Ivo brings more than 30 years of experience in the management, implementation and evaluation of  technical assistance and capacity building projects in Asia, Africa, Middle East and East and Central Europe. He joined Ecorys on the first of April 2011 and is currently leading on international business development. He brings specific experience working with international financing institutions, bilateral donors and developing country governments in the planning, management and evaluation of programmes covering social sector and public financial management issues.   

His specific professional experience is related to institutional development, capactity building and management consultancy in developing and emerging economies. He has been operating as a consultant, trainer, team leader, and during the past 10 yeras as project director of internationally funded projects (EU, DFID, World Bank and Dutch development assistance). He is well-versed in quality project and contract management and has recent experience working in fragile and conflict-affected states managing large multi-donor funds providing basic services and capacity building support for public service reform. He possesses in-depth knowledge of diverse aid delivery mechanisms  

He holds a Masters Degree in Economics from Erasmus University Rotterdam, with a specialisation in labour market economics and development economics. He has developed detailed knowledge of a broad range of development issues, resulting from nearly 30 years continual involvement in a range of diverse fields such as TVET, social protection, pensions, health, public administration and public financial management. Furthermore, he is an excellent report writer and evaluator, with recent involvement in complex evaluations, such as summative evaluations of aid to Afghanistan for Norway and Canada. Over the past 15 years, he has operated as a successful bid manager, with a track record of winning work with the international institutions.

projects.title: Support to Basic Services Delivery in South Sudan: Technical assistance for sub-national capacity buidling in payroll and PFM
projects.description:
Project Director for this large (€4,5 million) technical assistance project to help the Government of the Republic of South Sudan (GoRSS) to improve service delivery to citizens and implement the Local Services Support Joint Plan of Action (LSS JPA). 
The aim of the EU-TAPP project is not to introduce “new” policies and practices but it aims at increasing the capacity of local governments to implement and execute existing policies and directives in the fields of Payroll and PFM. Teams of PFM advisers are based in 7 out of South Sudan’s 10 States to provide hands-on support and coaching to sub-national levels of government to implement the local government PFM manual and payroll procedures.

contributors.headline: Director, International Development Unit at Ecorys
Director at Ecorys International Development Unit

projects.title: Implementing Agency for the National Pensions Regulatory Authority (NPRA) of Ghana
projects.description:
Project Director of this advisory and training project to improve the functioning and enhance the profile of the National Pensions Regulatory Authority in Ghana. NPRA has assumed the regulation and supervision of the reformed pension system in Ghana. It is a relatively new organisation that needs to build the institutional structures, the processes and procedures and other support systems to effectively carry out it's mandate of regulating and supervising all stakeholders in the industry (pension trustees, fund managers, custodian banks). 
In addition to an advisory team of three consultants, there is an investment fund of $800,000 available to finance specific sub-projects. The consultants, in close collaboration with NPRA and SECO, will play a facilitating role in the identification of investment projects, draft concept notes, produce Terms of Reference and organize call for proposals.

projects.title: Ex-Ante Evaluation, Feasibility Study and Baseline Survey for the Ghana - Netherlands Water, Sanitation and Hygiene Program
projects.description: Ecorys project manager for this assignment. The GNWP is a multi-annual programme that aims to improve sustainable uptake and access to urban water, sanitation and hygiene services in five municipalities of Greater Accra and Cape Coast/El Mina. Together with a local consultant, analysed the results of a baseline survey among 2000 households and produced the final report.

projects.title: Support to the Government Accountancy Training Centre (GATC fase II) in Juba, South Sudan
projects.description: Institutional capacity building of the GATC and assist the centre to provide PFM trainings to South-Sudanese civil servants. Roll-out of training on the Local Government PFM manual at the state level as well as selected counties.

projects.title: Afghanistan Program Summative Evaluation (FY 2004-05 to FY 2012-13)
projects.description: Part of a 7-member team to conduct this summative evaluation. Team member during the scoping mission to Afghanistan (May 2013) to produce an evaluation design and work plan. During the implementation phase (October 2013 – April 2014), worked as sector expert “Economic Growth” and produced the CIDA Afghanistan Program Economic Growth Sector Report, an evaluation of 10 years of CIDA support to private sector development and economic growth initiatives in Afghanistan. Also acted as the Ecorys project manager for this assignment, scheduling and quality supervising the internal and external input provided, and working closely with the team leader in producing the final evaluation report.

projects.title: Basic Services Fund, South Sudan
projects.description: The Basic Services Fund (BSF) was established in 2005 with the goal to support the Government of South Sudan (GoSS) in expanding primary education, primary health, and water and sanitation services to communities recovering from conflict.BSF receives support from International Donors and directly finances local and international NGOs to deliver basic services through primary education, primary health, water and sanitation projects. The fund was implemented between 2005 and 2012, for a period of 7 years, and has disbursed more than GBP 80 million in grants to local and international NGOs. The Fund was managed by a Steering Committee led by the Ministry of Finance and Economic Planning and administred by BMB Mott MacDonald as Fund Administrator. Between August 2006 and March 2011 Ivo was the Project Director of the BSF.

profile_positions.description:
Ecorys Project Director for a number of large assignments carried out by the International Development Unit of Ecorys:
- Technical Assistance to the Social Security Sector Programme in Bangladesh
- Support to the National Pension Regulatory Authority in Ghana
- Monitoring and Evaluation of the Facility for Refugees in Turkey - Phase 2
profile_positions.title: Director

profile_positions.description: Managing the Business Development unit of the Ecorys International Development Unit. An unit of about 15 international development specialists, working from offices in Rotterdam, Brussels, Sofia, Accra and Dhaka. Responsible for leading the unit and member in the IDU's management team.
profile_positions.title: Director, International Development Unit, Ecorys Nederland B.V.

profile_positions.description:
Managing  the Business Development Support Unit (BDSU) of the Ecorys International Development Practice to win and implement work with the international financing institutions. Providing business development, acquisition support, proposal development and project implementation services with a small team of professionals. Recent project acquisitions include:
- South Sudan: Fund Manager for the Civil Society Fund - 2016 - 2021
- Bangladesh: Strengthening Budget Preparation in Bangladesh - 2015-2016
- South Sudan: Technical Assistance to Sub-National levels of Government for Public Financial Management and Payroll Reform - 2014-2016
- Ghana: Implementing Agency for the National Pensions Regulatory Authority (NPRA) - 2014-2017
- Evaluation of the EU aid delivery instrument of delegated cooperation - 2014-2015
- South Sudan: Capacity Building of the Government Accountancy Training Centre (GATC) - 2013-2014
- Afghanistan: Summative Evaluation of CIDA's Afghanistan Programme 2003/04 - 2012/13;
- Ghana: Ex-ante Evaluation, Feasibility Study and Baseline Survey of the Ghana Netherlands Water, Sanitation and Hygiene Programme (GNWP) - 2013;
- Afghanistan: Evaluation of NORAD's Afghanistan Programme 2001/02 -2011/12
profile_positions.title: Partner, International Development

profile_positions.description: Leading the labour and social policy cluster, a group of 15 professionals in ECORYS Netherlands working on labour market, employment, social protection and social inclusion consultancy and research projects in the Netherlands, the European Union and internationally. Specific responsibility for acquiring and managing international work with the international financial institutions.

profile_positions.description: Reporting to the Managing Director and the Sub-Divisional Manager, the product manager leads a group of 10 professionals and oversees the service delivery provided by this group of experts, working on social sector development issues, including education, primary health, social protection and civil society strengthening. He ensures the technical quality and the innovative character of the service provision by experts working in the social sector field, both with respect to project preparation and acquisition, project implementation and product development. In doing so, he contributes to the overall commercial and technical performance of the Sub-Division.
